poem:
Title: Harvest Haiku

Whispers of wheat, wake,
In Kingsmill's shadow, they shake.
The owner, still tall, quakes.

"Small is the harvest yield,
import reliance, our shield,
prices in flux, concealed."

Weston's burden, bread and tea,
in an uncertain sea.
Simmering economy.
